Sentencas: In order to study the nickel coarsening in porous Ni/8YSZ anode cermets of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC), a series of exposure tests was carried out with anode substrates used in SOFC development at the Research Centre Julich.
Titulo: Nickel coarsening in annealed Ni/8YSZ anode substrates for solid oxide fuel cells -: In memoriam to Professor H.!Tagawa

Sentencas: The changes in electrical conductivity as well as in the microstructure of the material were investigated.
Titulo: Nickel coarsening in annealed Ni/8YSZ anode substrates for solid oxide fuel cells -: In memoriam to Professor H.!Tagawa

Sentencas: The microstructure of the cermets was characterized by digital on-line image analysis and microstructural parameters were determined for the metallic and the ceramic phase as well as for porosity.
Titulo: Nickel coarsening in annealed Ni/8YSZ anode substrates for solid oxide fuel cells -: In memoriam to Professor H.!Tagawa

Sentencas: A decrease of 33% of the initial electrical conductivity was measured after exposing the cermet in Ar/4% H-2/3% H2O at 1000 degrees C for 4000 h, which is linked to the agglomeration of the metallic particles of this material.
Titulo: Nickel coarsening in annealed Ni/8YSZ anode substrates for solid oxide fuel cells -: In memoriam to Professor H.!Tagawa

Sentencas: The durability of anode cermets for operations of up to 40 000 h was estimated on the basis of the measured grain coarsening and the decrease of conductivity.
Titulo: Nickel coarsening in annealed Ni/8YSZ anode substrates for solid oxide fuel cells -: In memoriam to Professor H.!Tagawa

Sentencas: The microstructural parameters - like volume fraction, particle and pore size - were used to model the electrical conductivity by theoretical microstructure-property relationships.
Titulo: Nickel coarsening in annealed Ni/8YSZ anode substrates for solid oxide fuel cells -: In memoriam to Professor H.!Tagawa
